publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7651 Jackie Baillie: John Corcoran, Chief Executive of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce—That the Parliament acknowledges the upcoming retirement of John Corcoran, Chief Executive Officer of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce; understands that John has announced that he will be standing down from his post on 31 December 2010; notes that John was the co-founder of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce in 2003 and believes that he has been successful in his mission to provide businesses in Dunbartonshire with a bigger and more effective voice, and congratulates John for all of his hard work and dedication in turning Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce into the vital resource that it is considered to be today.

S3M-7651 Jackie Baillie: John Corcoran, Chief Executive of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce—That the Parliament acknowledges the upcoming retirement of John Corcoran, Chief Executive Officer of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce; understands that John has announced that he will be standing down from his post on 31 December 2010; notes that John was the co-founder of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce in 2003 and believes that he has been successful in his mission to provide businesses in Dunbartonshire with a bigger and more effective voice, and congratulates John for all of his hard work and dedication in turning Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce into the vital resource that it is considered to be today. Supported by: Des McNulty*, Jamie McGrigor*, James Kelly*, Helen Eadie*
S3M-7651 John Corcoran, Chief Executive of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce (lodged on 22 December 2010) Mary Mulligan*, David Whitton*
S3M-7651 John Corcoran, Chief Executive of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce (lodged on 22 December 2010) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7651 Jackie Baillie: John Corcoran, Chief Executive of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce—That the Parliament acknowledges the upcoming retirement of John Corcoran, Chief Executive Officer of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce; understands that John has announced that he will be standing down from his post on 31 December 2010; notes that John was the co-founder of Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce in 2003 and believes that he has been successful in his mission to provide businesses in Dunbartonshire with a bigger and more effective voice, and congratulates John for all of his hard work and dedication in turning Dunbartonshire Chamber of Commerce into the vital resource that it is considered to be today. Supported by: Des McNulty, Jamie McGrigor, James Kelly, Helen Eadie, Mary Mulligan, David Whitton, Stuart McMillan
